_header: The king is wood and foul doth fare
Note:
See Herbert (1910)
XHerbert, John Alexander. Catalogue of Romances in the Department of MSS. in the British Museum. Vol. 3. London, 1910, 3.380.
_description: Summation of an exemplum from the Life of Kentigern — two couplets

Lam78.Transcription:
The kyng is wode and fowle doth fareThe qwene wepyth and makyth gret
                    careThe byschop prayth a lityl stowndeAnd thorwe the grace of owre
                    lady the ring ys fownd
